content.full_text:
Fitz Henry Warren to Abraham Lincoln, 31 March 18491 D. C. Eglestonethe Postmaster atRochesterCounty ofSangamonState ofIllinois, has resigned, and recommends appointment ofMunson Carteras his successor. Sundry Citizens concur in recommending MrCarter.2 Before submitting this Case to thePostmaster General, I have to request the favor of any information you may possess, or be able conveniently
                        to obtain, respecting it.
paragraphs: Fitz Henry Warren to Abraham Lincoln, 31 March 18491
D. C. Eglestonethe Postmaster atRochesterCounty ofSangamonState ofIllinois, has resigned, and recommends appointment ofMunson Carteras his successor.
Sundry Citizens concur in recommending MrCarter.2

Before submitting this Case to thePostmaster General, I have to request the favor of any information you may possess, or be able conveniently
                        to obtain, respecting it.

footnotes.text: 1Fitz Henry Warren signed his name to this form letter.

2Munson Carter would get the appointment in May 1849 and hold the position until after
                  the end of the Civil War.Fitz Henry Warren to Abraham Lincoln;Register of all Officers and Agents, Civil, Military, and Naval, in the Service of
